Tyrael watched intensively the battle going on. His second was really
doing good, but so was Deathsteel. He had managed to force the veteran
in the offesive, therefore having Kaiser committing himself. It was a
loyal dual until now and the Major was happy to have these troops with
him.

--- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, "raccoon7679" <raccoon7679@y...> wrote:
> DeathSteel::
> 
> He used  his finess with the battle blade to carefully counter the 
> blows that Kaiser was dishing out. Kaiser was good. But he wasn't 
> going to let this old battlebot beat him. He blocked a low blow then 
> swung upward towards kaiser's gut.
> 
> 
> 
> 
> --- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, Rudra656@a... wrote:
> > ::Kaiser::
> >        He hops back away from his opponent a short distance but 
> then angles 
> > his momentum back forward and unleashes a flurry of alternating 
> thrusts.  The 
> > thrusts begin at high and slowly start to work their way lower.
